greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) = (1/k!) * Sum_{i=0..k} (-1)^(k-i) * C(k,i) * A185651(n,i); triangle T(n,k), n >= 0, 0 <= k <= n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: Conjecture 1: T(n,k) = Stirling2(n,k) for k >= 1 and k <= n <= 2*k - 1.
Conjecture 2: T(n,k) = Stirling2(n,k) for k >= 2 and n prime >= 2.
maple: T:= (n, k)-> add((-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k, i)*A(n, i), i=0..k)/k!:
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = DivisorSum[n, EulerPhi[#]*k^(n/#)&];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 25 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 22 2015
